ADMINISTRATION.name: ADMINISTRATION
ADMINISTRATION.definition: Contains the legislative, regulatory, political and general administrative entities.

ADMINISTRATIVE AREA.name: ADMINISTRATIVE AREA
ADMINISTRATIVE AREA.definition: Places with officially defined boundaries for governance purposes

features.name: AGRICULTURAL AREA
features.definition: Area defined for agrigultural purposes

features.name: CATCHMENT MANAGEMENT
features.definition: An administrative bounded area proclaimed for water catchment protection

features.name: CENSUS DISTRICT
features.definition: A division of land for the purpose of counting the population

features.name: COUNTY
features.definition: A subdivision of Australia into land units

features.name: ANTARCTIC SPECIALLY MANAGED AREAS
features.definition: Areas intended to facilitate cooperation between nations operating in close proximity to each other, with a view to minimising environmental impacts. ASMAs may contain zones where various restrictions and permits might apply, and activities within ASMAs are governed by a code of conduct.

features.name: HUNDRED
features.definition: A subdivision of the COUNTIES into land units (GNR) in SA/WA which is a PARISH in other jurisdictions.

features.name: LOCAL GOVERNMENT AREA
features.definition: A municipal council

features.name: LOCALITY
features.definition: An administrative bounded area distinguished for its community and/or landscape characteristics: in metropolitan areas it is commonly referred to as a ÔÇÿsuburbÔÇÖ; it provides an official reference point for addressing purposes

features.name: MINING CENTRE
features.definition: ASK WA to define - 364

features.name: PARISH
features.definition: A subdivision of the COUNTIES into land units (GNR)

features.name: PASTORAL DISTRICT
features.definition: A classification of land to assist in the administration of pastoral runs.

features.name: STATE BORDER
features.definition: A division between federal jurisdictions
features.examples: e.g. Black Allen line and White Wade line, Sheaffe Line,

features.name: STATE/ TERRITORY
features.definition: Extent of land under the jurisdiction of a sovereign state
features.examples: e.g. Australian Antarctic Terriory, Territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands, Victoria, Northern Territory

features.name: TOWN SITE
features.definition: An original crown subdivision of land within a PARISH or HUNDRED which has officially recognised and gazetted boundaries.??

PROTECTED AREA.name: PROTECTED AREA
PROTECTED AREA.definition: Places with a legislated boundary for land management purposes

features.name: CONSERVATION PARK
features.definition: An area of land which is protected to ensure the cultural heritage and natural features are safeguarded. (excludes National Parks)

features.name: INDIGENOUS PROTECTED AREA
features.definition: An Indigenous Protected Area (IPA) is an area of Indigenous-owned land or sea where Traditional Owners have entered into an agreement with the Australian Government to promote biodiversity and cultural resource conservation.
features.examples: there are about 90 across Australia 50 declared e.g.

features.name: MARINE PARK
features.definition: MARINE PARK OR AQUATIC RESERVE

features.name: NATIONAL PARK
features.definition: A tract of land set apart, as by a state or nation, to be preserved in its natural state for the benefit of the public - Marine Parks held separately
features.includedTerms: Includes Wilderness Park or Area, Karst Conservation

features.name: ANTARCTIC SPECIALLY PROTECTED AREAS
features.definition: Areas set aside to protect outstanding environmental, scientific, historic, aesthetic or wilderness values, any combination of those values, or ongoing or planned scientific research.

features.name: STATE FOREST
features.definition: an area of protected forest under a Forest Act (either reserved or State Forest )

REGION.name: REGION
REGION.definition: Places with recognised charecteristics that may not have defined boundaries

features.name: ANTARCTIC LAND
features.definition: Large continental area defined by natural boundaries, or partly by natural boundaries and partly by boundaries of political convenience. The term was formally used by explorers for newly discovered lengths of coastline, cf. coast. Outside the area covered by this work the term may be synonymous with territory. The use of land does not refer to the ground, rather it is a generic part of a toponym.

features.name: TOURIST REGION
features.examples: Region See DB def. cultarl or tourist purposesWine regions, cultural regions

POPULATED PLACE.name: POPULATED PLACE
POPULATED PLACE.definition: Places relating to population entities, both current and historical

features.name: NEIGHBOURHOOD
features.definition: Does not have officially recognised and registered boundaries hence an unbounded locality: for this reason a neighbourhood name cannot be used for addressing purposes (GNR)

features.name: OUTCAMP
features.definition: Small Abopriginal  community outside of the main community

features.name: POPULATION CENTRE
features.definition: A significant place where there is permanent human habitation, infrastructure and services.

features.name: SETTLEMENT
features.definition: A small rural community, typically outside a larger urban area.

CULTURE.name: CULTURE
CULTURE.definition: Places that support activities and interactions of the community

ACCOMMODATION.name: ACCOMMODATION
ACCOMMODATION.definition: Places primarily used for short term accommodation

features.name: CARAVAN PARK
features.definition: A bounded area in which caravans are, or can be, parked, or where caravan type accommodation can be obtained; domestic facilities may be provided (GNR)

features.name: CAMP GROUND
features.definition: An area where a CAMP has been established or where it would be suitable to establish one; an area, often provided with amenities, where it is permitted to set up a camp (GNR)

AGRICULTURE.name: AGRICULTURE
AGRICULTURE.definition: Places where agricultural activities are undertaken

features.name: FARM
features.definition: A tract of land devoted for agricultural or horticultural purposes (GNR)
features.includedTerms: Special purpose farm, Research establishment, Agriculture establishment

features.name: PLANTATION
features.definition: A large quantity of trees that have been planted, commercial in nature

features.name: STOCKYARD
features.definition: An enclosure forming a pen for livestock

features.name: VINEYARD
features.definition: A plantation of grapevines, for producing grapes for winemaking, etc. (GNR)

BUSINESS.name: BUSINESS
BUSINESS.definition: Place  where the major activity is of a commercial nature.

features.name: ENTERTAINMENT CENTRE
features.definition: CONFERENCE OR EXHIBITION CENTRE OR ENTERTAINMENT CENTRE

features.name: HARNESS RACETRACK
features.definition: HARNESS OR TROTTING TRACK

features.name: MARKET
features.definition: An open space or covered building(s) in which provisions are exposed for sale (GNR)

features.name: MOTOR TRACK
features.definition: RACETRACK

features.name: POST OFFICE
features.definition: A facility to enables the distribution of mail

features.name: RACECOURSE
features.definition: A piece of ground on which horse races are held for public entertainment; any place where horse races are held (GNR)

features.name: SHOPPING CENTRE
features.definition: Typically a named area/property or group of retail businesses with their own infrastructure such as carparks.  E.g chadstone, westfield complex

COMMUNITY FACILITY.name: COMMUNITY FACILITY
COMMUNITY FACILITY.definition: Place to support specific public activities

features.name: AMPHITHEATRE
features.definition: An open-air venue for public events (GNR)
features.examples: New definition?  yeah it needs more definition, a circular or oval area of ground around which rows of seats are arranged on a steep slope - this term is not to include sports grounds or stadiums

features.name: ARBORETUM
features.definition: A garden devoted to trees

features.name: ART GALLERY
features.definition: An area or facility which displays art works

features.name: BOTANIC GARDENS
features.definition: A park or reserve which contains specialised collections of plants

features.name: CEMETERY
features.definition: An operational place/area for burying the dead
features.includedTerms: burial site, historic cemeteries should be held as historic sites

features.name: COMMUNITY GARDENS
features.definition: A piece of land which is managed and encourages members of the community to cultivate primarily for the production of food and to contribute to sustainability.

features.name: CONSERVATORY
features.definition: a public building with a glass roof and walls and used for growing delicate plants:

features.name: HALL
features.definition: A building where people may gather

features.name: LIBRARY
features.definition: A place in which literary materials, such as books, periodicals, newspapers, pamphlets, prints, records, and tapes, are kept for reading, reference, or lending.

features.name: MUSEUM
features.definition: An institution that cares for (conserves) a collection of artifacts and other objects of scientific, artistic, cultural, or historical importance and makes them available for public viewing

features.name: PARK
features.definition: An area of land often with recreational and other facilities which is set aside for public use (GNR)
features.includedTerms: City Square, Forecourt, Common, Rec Reserve, Local Park,

features.name: PICNIC SITE
features.definition: PICNIC SITE OR AREA (PSMA) A tract of land reserved for day picnic purposes, sometimes with constructed fireplaces and other facilities (GNR)

features.name: SHOWGROUND
features.definition: A tract of land with pavilion(s) and arena(s) for exhibition and display of livestock and produce (GNR)

COMMUNITY LIVING.name: COMMUNITY LIVING
COMMUNITY LIVING.definition: Places that provide medium to long term accommodation in a structured environment

INDUSTRY.name: INDUSTRY
INDUSTRY.definition: Place where the major activity is of a manufacturing or processing nature

features.name: ABATTOIR
features.definition: a slaughterhouse

features.name: BREWERY
features.definition: An establishment for brewing beer, ale, etc.

features.name: BRICKWORKS
features.definition: A place where bricks are made (GNR)

features.name: DISTILLERY
features.definition: A place where spirits are manufactured

features.name: MILL/TIMBER OPERATIONS
features.includedTerms: includes Mill, Paper Mill and Sawmill

features.name: SUGAR REFINERY
features.definition: A refinery to convert sugar cane and sugar beets into crystallized sugar and sugar syrups

features.name: TANNERY
features.definition: A building where hides and skins are processed into leather

LANDMARK.name: LANDMARK
LANDMARK.definition: Place that is a recognised entity by the community for specific identification purposes.

features.name: CAIRN
features.definition: A pyramidal heap of stones to mark a SUMMIT, TRACK, boundary, historical event, or a memorial to a person (GNR)

features.name: CORNER
features.definition: A place where two boundaries or ROADS meet; a region; a remote place

features.name: FENCE
features.definition: Fence

features.name: HISTORIC SITE
features.definition: SITE OF CULTURAL OR HISTORIC SIGNIFICANCE

features.name: HOMESTEAD
features.definition: A main residence on a horticultural or agricultural farm

features.name: JUNCTION
features.definition: A place where RIVERS, ROADS or RAILWAYS intersect

features.name: LEVEE
features.definition: Levee

features.name: LOOKOUT
features.definition: An observation or viewing point often a man-made structure

features.name: MONUMENT
features.definition: Anything by which the memory of persons or things are preserved; anything that serves as a memorial to a person, event, or of past times (GNR)

features.name: OUTSTATION
features.definition: Accomodation outside of the main homestead complex  within a pastoral property

features.name: SHIP WRECK
features.definition: The ruined remains of a stranded or sunken vessel which has been rendered useless (GNR)

features.name: SURVEY MARKER
features.includedTerms: Named Trig Point, survey obelisk, pillar, survey monument, cairns, Obelisk etc

PLACE OF WORSHIP.name: PLACE OF WORSHIP
PLACE OF WORSHIP.definition: Place used for spirtual observation or cermonial purposes

features.name: ABBEY
features.definition: A building or buildings occupied by monks or nuns under an abbot or abbess includes convent and monastery
features.includedTerms: term recognises both monastries and convents and to ensure unique feature subtypes has been removed

features.name: CHAPEL
features.definition: A place of worship connected with and subsidiary to a CHURCH; a place of worship other than a CHURCH or cathedral, especially in public institutions

features.name: CHURCH
features.definition: A building used for religious worship (GNR)

features.name: GURDWARA (SIKH)
features.definition: Sikh place of worship

features.name: MISSION
features.definition: An establishment administered by a religious community for the spiritual and social welfare of others

features.name: MONASTERY
features.definition: A religious residence for monks (GNR)

features.name: MONDIR (HINDU)
features.definition: Hindu place of worship

features.name: VIHARA (BUDDHIST)
features.definition: Buddhist place of worship

RECREATION.name: RECREATION
RECREATION.definition: Place where the major activity is of a sporting nature

features.name: ATHLETIC FIELD
features.definition: ATHLETIC FIELD OR TRACK

features.name: GOLF COURSE
features.definition: A ground or course over which golf is played (GNR)

features.name: SPORTS COMPLEX
features.definition: Area containing multiple recreation facilities

features.name: SPORT FACILITY
features.definition: a place, amenity, or piece of equipment related to sport provided for a particular purpose.
features.includedTerms: Sport Centre, Sports Stadium, Fitness Centre

features.name: SPORTSGROUND
features.definition: SPORTSGROUND OR FIELD, PLAYING FIELD MULTIPLE SPORTS, OVAL

features.name: TRAINING TRACK
features.definition: not a racetrack

features.name: VELODROME
features.definition: An arena with a suitably banked track for cycle races (GNR)

TOURISM.name: TOURISM
TOURISM.definition: Place where the major activity is perigination

features.name: AQUARIUM
features.definition: A facility for the public display of aquatic species

features.name: TOURIST ATTRACTION
features.definition: TOURIST ATTRACTION OR SITE

features.name: ZOO
features.definition: An establishment which maintains a collection of wild animals, typically in a park or gardens, for study, conservation, or display to the public.

HYDROLOGY.name: HYDROLOGY
HYDROLOGY.definition: Natural or man-made places which relate to the surface and underground water or marine environments

WATERBODY.name: WATERBODY
WATERBODY.definition: Natural or constructed places where a body of water may be available

features.name: ANCHORAGE
features.definition: A natural area in which vessels anchor or may anchor

features.name: BAY
features.definition: (a) An open, curving indentation made by the SEA or a LAKE (b) A body of water partly surrounded by land generally smaller than a GULF and larger than a COVE.(GNR)
features.examples: E.g. The Big Bight in Mallacoota

features.name: ENTRANCE
features.definition: A passageway into enclosed waters (GNR)

features.name: GULF
features.definition: An indentation in the sea or coast similar to a Bay, but either larger or with a greater curviture

features.name: INLET
features.definition: A small indentation in a waterline usually tapering towards its head

features.name: PASSAGE
features.definition: A navigable route, specifically one through REEFS ,ISLANDS, LANDS or shallow waters

features.name: SEA
features.definition: One of the smaller divisions of the OCEANS, especially if partly enclosed by land (GNR)

features.name: SOUND
features.definition: A named body of water, sometimes located in another body of water
features.examples: E.g. Capel Sound (Port Phillip) - through shallow water

features.name: AQUIFIER
features.definition: An underground waterbody.

features.name: DAM
features.definition: A small structure in generally undrained areas, built to contain water for stock purposes

features.name: LAGOON
features.definition: An enclosed area of shallow  salt or brackish water which is partly or completely  seperated from the SEA.

features.name: LAKE
features.definition: A body of fresh or salt water, natural or artificial, enclosed or nearly enclosed by land; it may or may not have in and outflowing water (either permanent, intermittent or largely dry)
features.includedTerms: includes backwash, back water, billabong, oxbow, fresh water lagoon,

features.name: RESERVOIR
features.definition: An artificial LAKE for the storage, regulation and control of water for domestic or other use

features.name: WETLAND
features.definition: Areas inundated or saturated by surface or groundwater at a frequency and duration sufficient to support vegetation typical of SWAMPS, MARSHES, bogs, etc.

WATER INFRASTRUCTURE.name: WATER INFRASTRUCTURE
WATER INFRASTRUCTURE.definition: Places that indicate constructed features associated with  water

features.name: BOAT RAMP
features.definition: ALSO KNOWN AS LANDING/BOAT RAMP OR BOAT LAUNCH

features.name: BREAKWATER
features.definition: An artificial structure capable of checking the force of waves, thereby reducing erosion or sheltering vessels from rough seas  (GNR)

features.name: DAM WALL
features.definition: A large man-made structure of earth, masonry, etc. built across a STREAM to impound water for any purpose

features.name: GROYNE
features.definition: A low artificial wall-like structure constructed of timber, stone, concrete or steel, usually extending roughly perpendicular to the SHORELINE and designed to protect the SHORE from erosion or to trap sand

features.name: HARBOUR
features.definition: An artificially improved body of water providing protection for vessels, and generally ANCHORAGE and docking facilities
features.examples: E.g. QLD example Inconsistencies with Anchorage. What do the hyrdrographics hold. Speak with Anne if she is till there. Let DB know.

features.name: JETTY
features.definition: A structure of stone or timber projecting into water, often private use and significantly smaller than a pier

features.name: LANDING PLACE
features.definition: A place where boats receive or discharge passengers, freight,

features.name: LOCK
features.definition: A stretch of water in a RIVER or CANAL enclosed by gates fitted with sluices to enable craft to be raised from one water level to another

features.name: PUMPING STATION
features.definition: A pumping station to support water flows

features.name: WATER TREATMENT
features.definition: A facility for the processes of making water more acceptable to end-user

features.name: WEIR
features.definition: A low barrier across a STREAM over which the water is allowed to flow steadily, although it raises the water level; it is also used to measure the flow and control the depth of water impounded,
features.includedTerms: includes Spillway, barrage - separate saline from fresh water

WATER POINT.name: WATER POINT
WATER POINT.definition: Natural or constructed places where water may be available

features.name: BORE
features.definition: A deep veritcal hole of a small diameter made to obtain water or to ascertain the nature of the underlaying strata

features.name: SOAK
features.definition: Damp or swampy spots around the base of granite ROCKS or in otherwise dry watercourse

features.name: SPRING
features.definition: A flow of water issuing naturally out of the ground, either continuously or intermittently (GNR)
features.includedTerms: mineral spring, Pool spring, Hot spring

features.name: WATERHOLE
features.definition: A small body of still or standing water, permanent or temporary, often in the bed of an intermittent RIVER or STREAM, and sometimes SPRING fed, chiefly one of natural formation. included terms POOL, POND

WATERWAY.name: WATERWAY
WATERWAY.definition: Natural or contructed places that are assoctaed with the movement of water

features.name: BEND
features.definition: A curve in the course of a STREAM

features.name: CANAL
features.definition: MAN MADE FEATURE ALSO USED FOR TRANSPORT

features.name: CHANNEL
features.definition: A man made watercourse used for irrigation. Can be open or closed

features.name: DRAIN
features.definition:
An artificially constructed
WATERCOURSE
designed for the purpose of removing surplus water from the land surface.  Can be open or closed

features.name: ESTUARY
features.definition: (a) The portion of a RIVER where tidal effects are evident and where fresh water and sea water mix (b) The widening out lower portion of a tidal RIVER

features.name: RAPIDS
features.definition: Portions of a STREAM with accelerated current where it descends rapidly without a break in the slope of the bed sufficient to form a WATERFALL

features.name: REACH
features.definition: A straight portion of WATERCOURSE  from one BEND to another

features.name: WATERCOURSE
features.definition: A course of running water (either permanent, intermittent or largely dry);
features.includedTerms: includes Anabranch, Brook, creek, river, gully, Stream, Run, Rivulet

features.name: WATERFALL
features.definition: A sudden descent of water over a step in the bed of a STREAM.

TERRAIN.name: TERRAIN
TERRAIN.definition: Places that reflect the physical attributes of the land surface

LANDFORM.name: LANDFORM
LANDFORM.definition: A natural feature of the earths surface

features.name: TIDAL FLAT
features.definition: A large area of nearly level land, usually of mud, covered at high water and attached to the SHORE

features.name: NUNATAK
features.definition: A small mountain, rocky crag or outcrop projecting from a glacier, ice shelf or snowfield.

features.name: BANK
features.definition: The sloping ground along the edge of water

features.name: BAR
features.definition: A BAR of sand, coral, mud formed in a SEA or RIVER, exposed at low tide and formed by the action of the tides or currents (GNR)

features.name: BEACH
features.definition: A sloping shore along water that is periodically washed by waves or tides and is usually covered in sand or gravel.

features.name: BLOWHOLE
features.definition: A hole near the seashore that has been formed in the roof of a CAVE, and through which air and possibly water are forced by the rising tide

features.name: CAPE
features.definition: A area of land projecting into a body of water, may contain a point (s), or HEAD

features.name: CAVE
features.definition: A hollowed-out chamber in the Earth, or in the side of a CLIFF or HILL; especially a larger natural cavity in the earth with an opening to the surface (GNR)

features.name: CLIFF
features.definition: A perpendicular or steep face of ROCK of considerable height either inland or along the COAST (GNR)
features.includedTerms: Jump ups, bluff, breakaway, rockface, crag, precipice, buttress

features.name: COAST
features.definition: Boundary between land and sea, applied in place-names to lengths of coastline determined partly by the history of their discovery and partly by convenient demarcation points

features.name: CRATER
features.definition: (a) A funnel-shaped hollow at the top of the cone of a volcano (b) A hollow caused by the fall of a meteorite on to the Earth's surface (GNR)

features.name: DEPRESSION
features.definition: Any hollow or relatively sunken area, on land

features.name: DESERT
features.definition: An almost barren tract of land in which the precipitation is so scant or spasmodic that it will not adequately support vegetation

features.name: DUNE
features.definition: a mound or ridge of drifted sand, occurring on the sea coast, near inland water bodies and in deserts

features.name: ESCARPMENT
features.definition: The steep slope terminating a Plateau or any level or upland surface

features.name: GORGE
features.definition: A valley which is more then usually deep and narrow, with step walls.

features.name: HILL
features.definition: A small portion of the Earth's surface elevated above its surroundings: in general, an feature is not considered a MOUNTAIN unless its ELEVATION, from foot to SUMMIT, is well over 300m, but the distinction is arbitrary (PSMA()
features.includedTerms: KNOLL, KNOB, MESA, SUGARLOAF, TOR (PSMA). Butte, Hillock

features.name: ISLAND
features.definition: a tract of land completely surrounded by water
features.includedTerms: Offshore rock(s), Atoll, Isle, Islet, Clumps, Skerry

features.name: ISLAND GROUP
features.definition: A group of Islands often with a common name which covers the group. The Islands may have their own individual names.  The island group can any combination of rocks, reefs, islets and islands names.

features.name: ISTHMUS
features.definition: A narrow portion of land enclosed on each side by water and connecting two larger bodies of land

features.name: MORAINE
features.definition: A mound, ridge, or other distinct accumulation of unsorted, unstratified glacial drift, predominantly till, deposited primarily by direct action of glacier ice, in a variety of topographic landforms that are independent of control by the surface on which the drift lies.

features.name: MOUNTAIN
features.definition: A natural ELEVATION of the Earth's surface rising more or less abruptly from the surrounding level, and attaining an altitude which, relative to adjacent ELEVATIONs, is impressive or notable. In general the ELEVATION of a mountain is more then 300m from foot to summit, but this distinction is arbitary.

features.name: PAN
features.definition: A small depression, intermitently containing water, in which  may sometimes hold depsoits, typically clay or salt.

features.name: PASS
features.definition: A break or GAP in a MOUNTAIN RANGE permitting easier passage from one side to the other

features.name: PEAK
features.definition: A high point of a mountain or a ridge
features.includedTerms: Summit(s), PINNACLE, NEEDLE, PILLAR Rock column,  Heights, Aiguilles

features.name: PENINSULA
features.definition: An area of land almost surrounded by water and significantly larger than a CAPE

features.name: PLAIN
features.definition: A relatively level area within a region of greater relief; a small area without relief (GNR)
features.includedTerms: Includes Flat, Downs, Prairie, volcanic / lava plain, Clearing

features.name: PLATEAU
features.definition: An elevated tract of comparatively flat or level land (GNR)

features.name: POINT
features.definition: The extreme end of a CAPE or a Peninsula or the outer end of any land protruding into the water, usually less prominent than a CAPE
features.examples: E.g. rafe to organise pic showing point, cape and penisula relationship

features.name: POCKET
features.definition: An area of land encompassed by the meander of a river.

features.name: RANGE
features.definition: A series or line of MOUNTAIN or HILLS with or without PEAKS in which the crests are relatively narrow

features.name: RIDGE
features.definition: A long and narrow stretch of elevated ground, either isolated or located in a RANGE (GNR)

features.name: ROCK
features.definition: A prominent or isolated outcrop of stone:

features.name: ROCKHOLE
features.definition: A HOLE erroded in Rock. Not a waterhole, often used as water storage
features.includedTerms: Gnamma Hole, Native Well, sink hole, runaway hole.

features.name: SLOPE
features.definition: A gradient on the side or end of an elevated relief feature.
features.includedTerms: gradiants, ski slopes, Hillside, Toboggan run

features.name: BENCH
features.definition: Usually applied to a high-level rock feature, similar to a terrace.

features.name: CIRQUE
features.definition: A deep rounded hollow on a mountain side formed by glacial action and usually occupied by a remnant glacier or neve.

features.name: SPIT
features.definition: A narrow strip of land projecting into a body of water from the Coast

features.name: VALLEY
features.definition: A long narrow depression in the Earth's surface, usually with a fairly regular downward slope (GNR)

UNDER ICE.name: UNDER ICE
UNDER ICE.definition: A natural feature of the earths surface under water

features.name: SUBGLACIAL BASIN
features.definition: Subglacial: a term meaning 'beneath the ice'. Basin: a very large depression occupied by sea water, ie. an ocean basin.

features.name: SUBGLACIAL MOUNT
features.definition: Subglacial: a term meaning 'benearth the ice'. Mountain: A mass of land considerably higher than its surroundings and of greater altitude than a hill.

features.name: SUBGLACIAL TRENCH
features.definition: Subglacial: a term meaning 'benearth the ice'. Trench: A deep, or elongated trough, in a floor of the ocean.

UNDERSEA.name: UNDERSEA
UNDERSEA.definition: A natural feature of the earths surface under water

features.name: ABYSSAL PLAIN (MARINE)
features.definition: An extensive, flat or gently sloping region, usually found at depths greater than 4000 m.

features.name: APRON (MARINE)
features.definition: A gently dipping SLOPE, with a smooth surface, commonly found around groups of islands and SEAMOUNTS.

features.name: BANK (MARINE)
features.definition: An ELEVATION of the seafloor at depths generally less than 200 m, but sufficient for safe surface navigation commonly found on the continental shelf or near an island.

features.name: BASIN (MARINE)
features.definition: A depression more or less equidimensional in plan and of variable extent.

features.name: CALDERA (MARINE)
features.definition: A roughly circular, cauldron-like depression generally characterized by steep sides and formed by collapse, or partial collapse, during or following a volcanic eruption.

features.name: CANYON (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated, narrow, steep-sided depression that generally deepens down-slope.

features.name: CONTINENTAL MARGIN (MARINE)
features.definition: The zone, generally consisting of SHELF, SLOPE and CONTINENTAL RISE, separating the continent from the deep seafloor or ABYSSAL PLAIN. Occasionally a TRENCH may be present in place of a CONTINENTAL RISE.

features.name: DEEP (MARINE)
features.definition: A localized depression within the confines of a larger feature, such as a TROUGH, BASIN or TRENCH.

features.name: ESCARPMENT (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated, characteristically linear, steep SLOPE separating horizontal or gently sloping areas of the sea floor.

features.name: FAN (MARINE)
features.definition: A relatively smooth depositional feature continuously deepening away from a sediment source commonly located at the lower termination of a CANYON or canyon system.

features.name: FRACTURE ZONE (MARINE)
features.definition: A long narrow zone of irregular topography formed by the movement of tectonic plates associated with an offset of a spreading ridge axis, characterized by steep-sided and/or asymmetrical RIDGES, TROUGHS or ESCARPMENTS.

features.name: GAP (MARINE)
features.definition: A narrow break in a RIDGE, RISE or other ELEVATION. Also called PASSAGE.

features.name: GUYOT (MARINE)
features.definition: A SEAMOUNT with a comparatively smooth flat top.

features.name: HILL (MARINE)
features.definition: A distinct ELEVATION generally of irregular shape, less than 1000m above the surrounding relief as measured from the deepest isobath that surrounds most of the feature.

features.name: HOLE (MARINE)
features.definition: A depression of limited extent with all sides rising steeply from a relatively flat bottom.

features.name: KNOLL (MARINE)
features.definition: A distinct ELEVATION with a rounded profile less than 1000m above the surrounding relief as measured from the deepest isobath that surrounds most of the feature.

features.name: LEVEE (MARINE)
features.definition: A depositional embankment bordering a CANYON, VALLEY or SEA CHANNEL.

features.name: MOAT (MARINE)
features.definition: An annular or partially annular depression commonly located at the base of SEAMOUNTS, islands and other isolated ELEVATIONs.

features.name: MOUND (MARINE)
features.definition: A distinct ELEVATION with a rounded profile generally less than 500m above the surrounding relief as measured from the deepest isobath that surrounds most of the feature, commonly formed by the expulsion of fluids or by coral reef development, sedimentation and (bio)erosion.

features.name: MUD VOLCANO (MARINE)
features.definition: A MOUND or cone-shaped ELEVATION formed by the expulsion of non-magmatic liquids and gasses.

features.name: PASSAGE (MARINE)
features.definition: A narrow break in a RIDGE, RISE or other ELEVATION. Also called GAP.

features.name: PEAK (MARINE)
features.definition: A conical or pointed ELEVATION at the summit of a larger feature.

features.name: PINNACLE (MARINE)
features.definition: A spire-shaped pillar either isolated or at the summit of a larger feature.

features.name: PLATEAU (MARINE)
features.definition: A large, relatively flat ELEVATION that is higher than the surrounding relief with one or more relatively steep sides.

features.name: PROVINCE (MARINE)
features.definition: A geographically distinct region with a number of shared physiographic characteristics that contrast with those in the surrounding areas. This term should be modified with the generic term that best describes the majority of features in the region (e.g., Seamount in ÔÇ£Baja California Seamount ProvinceÔÇØ).

features.name: REEF (MARINE)
features.definition: A shallow ELEVATION composed of consolidated material that may constitute a hazard to surface navigation.

features.name: RIDGE (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated ELEVATION of varying complexity, size and gradient.

features.name: RIFT (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated depression bounded by two or more faults formed as a breach or split between two bodies that were once joined.

features.name: RISE (MARINE)
features.definition: A broad ELEVATION that generally rises gently and smoothly from the surrounding relief.

features.name: SADDLE (MARINE)
features.definition: A broad pass or col in a RIDGE, RISE or other ELEVATION.

features.name: SALT DOME (MARINE)
features.definition: A distinct ELEVATION, often with a rounded profile, one km or more in diameter that is the geomorphologic expression of a diapir formed by vertical intrusion of salt. Commonly found in a PROVINCE of similar features.

features.name: SAND RIDGE (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated feature of unconsolidated sediment of limited vertical relief and sometimes crescent shaped. Commonly found in a PROVINCE of similar features.

features.name: SEA CHANNEL (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated, meandering depression, usually occurring on a gently sloping plain or FAN.

features.name: SEAMOUNT (MARINE)
features.definition: A distinct generally equidimensional ELEVATION greater than 1000m above the surrounding relief as measured from the deepest isobath that surrounds most of the feature.

features.name: SEAMOUNT CHAIN (MARINE)
features.definition: A linear or arcuate alignment of discrete SEAMOUNTS.

features.name: SHELF (MARINE)
features.definition: The flat or gently sloping region adjacent to a continent or around an island that extends from the low water line to a depth, generally about 200m, where there is a marked increase in downward slope.
features.includedTerms: Borderland, Continental Shelf, Shelf Break, Shelf Edge

features.name: SHOAL (MARINE)
features.definition: A shallow ELEVATION composed of unconsolidated material that may constitute a hazard to surface navigation.

features.name: SILL (MARINE)
features.definition: A relatively shallow barrier between BASINS that may inhibit water movement.

features.name: SLOPE (MARINE)
features.definition: The sloping region that deepens from a SHELF to the point where there is a general decrease in gradient.

features.name: SPUR (MARINE)
features.definition: A subordinate RIDGE protruding from a larger feature.

features.name: TERRACE (MARINE)
features.definition: A flat or gently sloping region, generally long and narrow, bounded along one edge by a steeper descending slope and along the other by a steeper ascending slope.

features.name: TRENCH (MARINE)
features.definition: A long, deep, asymmetrical depression with relatively steep sides, that is associated with subduction.

features.name: TROUGH (MARINE)
features.definition: A long depression generally wide and flat bottomed with symmetrical and parallel sides.

features.name: VALLEY (MARINE)
features.definition: An elongated depression that generally widens and deepens down-slope. Also called SEA VALLEY or SUBMARINE VALLEY.
features.includedTerms: Median Valley, Sea Valley, Submarine Valley

LANDCOVER.name: LANDCOVER
LANDCOVER.definition: Places that are charcterised by the physical covering on the surface of the earth.

VEGETATION.name: VEGETATION
VEGETATION.definition: Places named as a result of the naturaly occuring flora

features.name: FOREST
features.includedTerms: Wood, Thicket, Copse, Brushwood, Glade, Grove

ICE FEATURE.name: ICE FEATURE
ICE FEATURE.definition: Places named as a result of the weather conditions

features.name: DOME
features.definition: A rounded and gently sloping elevation in the surface of an inland ice sheet. Ice domes do not have precisely defined margins and may cover very large areas - more than 100,000km sq, for example.

features.name: ICE FIELD
features.definition: Flat glaciated area, underlying topography is not completely levelled out

features.name: GLACIER
features.definition: A mass of snow and ice continuously moving from higher to lower ground or, if afloat, continuously spreading.

features.name: ICE SHELF
features.definition: A floating ice sheet of considerable thickness attached to a coast. Ice shelves are usually of great horizontal extent and have a level or gently undulating surface. They are nourished by the accumulation of snow and often by seaward extension of land glaciers. Limited areas may be aground. The seaward edge is termed an ice front.

features.name: ICEFALL
features.definition: The portion of a glacier at a point of steep descent, segmented by many transverse crevasses into separate blocks.

features.name: MASSIF
features.definition: Compact group of mountain heights, which may be partly or almost entirely ice-covered.

features.name: NEVE
features.definition: The crystalline or granular snow on the upper part of a glacier, which has not yet been compressed into ice; a field or bed of frozen snow.

MINING.name: MINING
MINING.definition: Place that reflect the adminstration extraction and processing of minerals, rock, gas and oil.

EXTRACTION.name: EXTRACTION
EXTRACTION.definition: an excavation in the earth for the extraction of materials

features.name: ABANDONED MINE
features.definition: desc

features.name: ADIT
features.definition: An entrance to a mine

features.name: GAS/OIL PLATFORM
features.definition: An oil/gas platform, offshore platform, or (colloquially) oil rig is a large structure with facilities to drill wells, to extract and process oil and natural gas

features.name: MINE (OPEN CUT)
features.definition: A place or area from which commercial minerals are removed from the Earth

features.name: MINE (UNDERGROUND)
features.definition: A place or area from which commercial minerals are removed from the Earth

features.name: QUARRY
features.definition: A place where soli, stone or rock is extracted (GNR)

features.name: GAS/OIL FIELD
features.definition: A area in which natural gas occurs in quantities worthy of exploitation

features.name: GOLD FIELD
features.definition: An area gold is, or was removed from the Earth

features.name: OPALFIELD
features.definition: An area where opals is, or was, removed from the Earth

features.name: BATTERY
features.definition: A stone crushing works for ore extraction, as used on gold fields

features.name: IRON ORE PROCESSOR
features.definition: An iron ore processing plant

features.name: OIL REFINERY
features.definition: A refinery to convert crude oil from the oil terminals and delivered to the gas plants (processing)

features.name: SMELTER
features.definition: An industrial plant for smelting

SOCIETY.name: SOCIETY
SOCIETY.definition: Places that support the provision of support services to the community

features.name: AGED CARE
features.definition: A facility that supports the care of the eldery

features.name: CHILD CARE
features.definition: Caters for babies from 0.5 months up to 3 years

DEFENCE.name: DEFENCE
DEFENCE.definition: A place for preparation for defence of the country

features.name: AIR FORCE BASE
features.definition: A facility used by the Air Force for the operation and/or training of  personnel and their aircraft

features.name: ARMY BASE
features.definition: A facility used by the army for the operation and/or training of  personnel and their vehicles

features.name: BARRACKS
features.definition: A building or buildings used for the lodgement or residence of soldiers (GNR)

features.name: BOMBING RANGE
features.definition: A tract of land on which the military conducts bombing practice

features.name: NAVAL BASE
features.definition: A facility used by the seaman for the operation and/or training of  personnel and their vessels

features.name: EDUCATION COMPLEX
features.definition: education area containing multiple types of education centres

features.name: FURTHER EDUCATION
features.definition: Post secondary education excluding UNIVERSITY and TAFEs

features.name: KINDERGARTEN
features.definition: post childcare 3-5 years

features.name: PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL
features.definition: A COMBINED PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL

features.name: PRIMARY SCHOOL
features.definition: An education facility that caters for 5- 12 year olds, private and public

features.name: SCHOOL CAMP
features.definition: A facility administered by an education centre

features.name: SECONDARY SCHOOL
features.definition: An education facility that caters for 12- 18 year olds, private and public

features.name: SPECIAL SCHOOL
features.definition: An educational facility that caters for those with learning disabilities

features.name: TERTIARY INSTITUTION
features.definition: Post secondary (TAFEs) education excluding University.

features.name: UNIVERSITY
features.definition: An educational institution for both instruction and examination in the higher branches of knowledge with the power to confer degrees (GNR)

EMERGENCY.name: EMERGENCY
EMERGENCY.definition: A place for governance of emergency services

features.name: AMBULANCE STATION
features.definition: A structure or other area set aside for storage ofambulance vehicles and medical equipment (GNR)

features.name: EMERGENCY COMPLEX
features.definition: EMERGENCY COMPLEX OR EMERGENCY SERVICES AGENCY -  emergency faciltiy area containing multiple types of emergency facilty each may have its own name

features.name: EMERGENCY CONTROL CENTRE
features.definition: A facility to coordinate multiple agencies

features.name: FIRE LOOKOUT
features.definition: FIRE TOWER OR OBSERVATION TOWER

features.name: FIRE STATION
features.includedTerms: includes ALL types of fire stations. Eg urban, rural, forest industry

features.name: LIFESAVING CLUB
features.definition: A patrol and response service for those that in dificulty in the water

features.name: NEIGHBOURHOOD SAFER PLACE
features.definition: AN AREA OR PREMISES THAT MAY, AS A LAST RESORT, PROVIDE SOME SANCTUARY FROM THE LIFE THREATENING EFFECTS OF A BUSHFIRE (I.E. DIRECT FLAME CONTACT OR RADIANT HEAT).

features.name: POLICE STATION
features.definition: An office of the local police force; it may or may not have associated lock-up (gnr)

features.name: REFUGE
features.definition: Aa purpose built or modified fire proof building. VIC

features.name: SES FACILITY
features.definition: STATE EMERGENCY SERVICES FACILITY

HEALTH.name: HEALTH
HEALTH.definition: a building for treatment of people

features.name: BUSH NURSING HOSPITAL
features.definition: A hospital that operates primarily in the rural areas

features.name: SPECIALISED HOSPITAL
features.definition: A hospital specifically for the care of a specific group or part of the body
features.includedTerms: Childrens Hospital, Womens Hospital, Ear and Eye Hospital, Dental, etc

features.name: COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTRE
features.definition: A health facility that caters for the community, urban and rural
features.includedTerms: bush nursing centre, but not MCH (Maternal Child Health Centre)

features.name: GENERAL HOSPITAL
features.definition: An institution in which the sick or injured persons are given medical or surgical treatment

features.name: GENERAL HOSPITAL (EMERGENCY)
features.definition: A general hospital with 24hour emergency service

features.name: HOSPITAL COMPLEX
features.definition: An area containing multiple hospitals

features.name: MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH CENTRE
features.definition: A health facility that caters for the maternal and child health needs of a community

features.name: MEDICAL CENTRE
features.definition: A doctors surgery

LEGAL.name: LEGAL
LEGAL.definition: A place for governance of services

features.name: DIPLOMATIC MISSION
features.definition: OFFICE OF A COUNTRY'S DIPLOMATIC REPRESENTATIVES

features.name: LAW COURT
features.includedTerms: Includes COURT, Magistrates Court, COURT HOUSE Supreme Court, High Court OR TRIBUNAL

features.name: PRISON
features.definition: A building where persons are legally committed, while awaiting trial or punishment (GNR)
features.includedTerms: Includes Gaol, Remand or Detention centre, rehabilitation centre

TRANSPORT.name: TRANSPORT
TRANSPORT.definition: Places associated with the movement of people, goods,freight and cargo

AIR.name: AIR
AIR.definition: an area for air traffic and support infrastructure

features.name: LANDING AREA
features.definition: For the operation of aircraft, may be public or private.

features.name: AIRPORT
features.definition: Regulated A landing and taking off area for civil aircraft, usually equipped with runways and aircraft maintenance and passenger facilities (GNR)
features.examples: FOR Discussion refer to CASA, they use Aerodrome

features.name: HELIPAD
features.definition: A place for helicopters to land and take-off, like 'runway' is to 'airport'

features.name: HELIPORT
features.definition: HELIPAD  OR HELIPORT, like 'airport' is to 'runway'

RAIL.name: RAIL
RAIL.definition: the course of a transport mode

features.name: CABLEWAY
features.definition: CHAIRLIFT OR CABLECAR

features.name: LIGHT RAIL
features.definition: A track or set of tracks of iron or steel rails used for the passage of light rail

features.name: LIGHT RAIL STATION
features.definition: a place where passengers are exchanged between vehicles or between transport modes

features.name: RAIL STATION
features.definition: a place where passengers are exchanged between vehicles or between transport modes

features.name: RAIL YARD
features.definition: an area of railway tracks and sidings for storage and maintenance of trains

features.name: RAILWAY
features.definition: A track or set of tracks of iron or steel rails used for the passage of trains

features.name: SIDING
features.definition: A short branch off a RAILWAY track, often connected at both ends to the mainline track, and used for shunting or for loading, unloading, and storing goods trucks (GNR)

ROAD.name: ROAD
ROAD.definition: the course of a transport mode

features.name: BUS DEPOT
features.definition: an area for storage and maintenance of buses

features.name: BUS ROUTE
features.definition: The set route taken by a bus service

features.name: BUS STOP
features.definition: a designated place where buses stop for passengers to board or alight

features.name: CAR PARK
features.definition: Where vechiles are parked

features.name: CAUSEWAY
features.definition: a structure that facilitates the crossing of road, railway or watercourse over under or through another feature

features.name: ROAD CUTTING
features.definition: an excavation in the earths surface to create a thoroughfare for a road, railway or watercourse

features.name: FORD
features.definition: A solid way, the shallow part of a RIVER or other body of water which may  be crossed by vehicle or by wading

features.name: GATE
features.definition: a structure used to regulate movement associated with road or rail

features.name: REST AREA
features.definition: An area at the side of a road or highway for vehicles to stop away from traffic; with toilet and possibly picnic facilities (GNR)

features.name: ROUNDABOUT
features.definition: a structure that facilitates the crossing of multiple roads

features.name: TAXI RANK
features.definition: a designated place where taxis stop for passengers to board or alight

features.name: TOLL
features.definition: a structure used to regulate movement associated with road or rail

features.name: WEIGHBRIDGE
features.definition: a structure used to regulate movement associated with road or rail

TRAIL.name: TRAIL
TRAIL.definition: a defined path, route or track that often traverses natural areas

features.name: BICYCLE TRACK
features.definition: A trail designed for bicycle traffic in the main. This is not a shared roadway with vehicular traffic. Main use is cyclying.

features.name: CYCLE CROSSING
features.definition: a structure that facilitates the crossing of road, railway or watercourse over under or through another feature

features.name: FIREBREAK
features.definition: FIREBREAK OR FIREGUARD (PSMA) A strip of ploughed or cleared land made to check the spread of fire (GNR)

features.name: HORSE RIDING TRAIL
features.definition: A trail designed for horse riding traffic in the main.

features.name: MOUNTAIN BIKE TRACK
features.definition: A trail designed for mountain bike traffic in the main.

features.name: MULTIUSE TRAIL
features.definition: A pathway designed for shared use access, being walking ans bicycle traffic and may also include horse riding or skiing or may be any combination of multiple use. Main uses cycling and walking.

features.name: SKI TRAIL
features.definition: A trail designed for downhill or cross country in the main.

features.name: WALKING TRACK
features.definition: A trail designed for foot traffic in the main. This is not a shared roadway with vehicular traffic. Main use is walking.

features.name: BEACON
features.definition: A prominent, man made structure to guide vessels, vehicles or aircraft

features.name: CONTROL TOWER
features.definition: Air and shipping control towers

features.name: DOCK
features.definition: a structure where a vessel is constructed or repaired ICSM

features.name: FERRY ROUTE
features.definition: The set route taken by a ferry service

features.name: FERRY STATION
features.definition: a designated place where ferries stop for passengers to board or alight

features.name: LIGHTHOUSE
features.definition: A distinctive structure on or off the COAST, exhibiting a major LIGHT designed to serve as an aid to navigation (GNR)

features.name: MARINA
features.definition: An area provided with berthing and shore facilities (including toilets, water and rubbish disposal) particularly for yachts and other pleasure craft

features.name: PIER
features.definition: A long narrow structure extending into the water to afford a berthing place for vessels; to serve as a pleasure promenade (GNR)

features.name: PORT
features.definition: A place provided with terminal and transfer facilities for loading and discharging cargo or passengers, usually located in a HARBOUR (gnr)

features.name: WHARF
features.definition: A platform, contiguous to and more or less parallel with the SHORELINE, alongside of which ships may be secured for loading or unloading cargo or passengers

UTILITIES.name: UTILITIES
UTILITIES.definition: Places relating to the provision of information and functional services in the community.

COMMUNICATION.name: COMMUNICATION
COMMUNICATION.definition: a recognised cultural site of some importance

features.name: COMMUNICATION TOWER
features.definition: A structure that supports communication devices
features.includedTerms: radio tower, television tower, broadcasting tower

features.name: RADIO COMMUNICATION FACILITY
features.definition: An antenna for the transmission of sound by radio waves to a widely dispersed audience through radio receivers

features.name: RADIO STATION
features.definition: A facility to operate the transmission of radio broadcasts

features.name: TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
features.definition: A facility to establish telecommunication connections.

features.name: TELEVISION COMMUNICATION FACILITY
features.definition: An antenna for transmission of sound and images by radio waves to a widely dispersed audience through television receivers

features.name: TELEVISION STATION
features.definition: A facility to operate the transmission of television broadcasts

features.name: FIBER OPTIC CABLE
features.definition: A wire used for the distribution of digital communications

ENERGY.name: ENERGY
ENERGY.definition: A facility for the generation/transmission of electric power

features.name: BIOMASS POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power from waste from sugar cane, municipal solid waste, landfill methane or other forms of biomass.

features.name: COAL POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power from coal

features.name: POWER DISTRIBUTION
features.definition: A wire used for the distribution of electricity

features.name: GAS PIPELINE
features.definition: A pipeline used for gas transmission

features.name: GAS PLANT
features.definition: A gas/oil processing/conditioning plant include

features.name: GAS POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power from gas

features.name: GEO THERMAL POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power from steam extracted from hot underground rocks

features.name: HYDRO POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power from the energy provided by difference in water level upstream and downstream

features.name: OIL PIPELINE
features.definition: A pipeline used for oil transmission

features.name: POWER SUB STATION
features.definition: A facility whose primary purpose is to convert incoming sub-transmission voltages to high voltage distribution voltages -usually owned by the distribution company

features.name: POWER SUB TRANSMISSION
features.definition: A wire used for the transmission of electricity usually < 66KV

features.name: POWER TERMINAL STATION
features.definition: A facility whose primary purpose is to convert incoming transmission voltages to voltages suitable for distribution networks-usually owned by the transmission company

features.name: POWER TRANSMISSION
features.definition: A wire used for the transmission of electricity usually > 66KV

features.name: SOLAR POWER STATION
features.definition: A process plant that creates power either directly in solar cells, or in a concentrating solar power plant by focusing the light to run a heat engine

features.name: WIND FARM
features.definition: Consists of a group of individual wind turbines which are connected to the electric power transmission network.

features.name: WIND TURBINE
features.definition: A  turbine used to generate electricity in areas with strong, steady winds, sometimes offshore

features.name: WEATHER STATION
features.definition: A weather station

WASTE.name: WASTE
WASTE.definition: an area for disposal of various types of material

features.name: SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT
features.definition: A facility for the process of removing contaminants from wastewater

features.name: SEWER PIPELINE
features.definition: A pipeline used for sewer transmission
